problem_text:
b) What is the minimal possible rate of growth of the function π(n) = max δ(g)⩽n |g| for the class of groups indicated in part “a” of this problem (see Archive)? It is known (R. I. Grigorchuk, Math. USSR–Izv., 25 (1985), 259–300) that there exist p-groups with π(n) ⩽ nλ for some λ > 0. At the same time, it follows from a result of E. I. Zel’manov that π(n) is not bounded if G is infinite.
R. I. Grigorchuk
